headline: Is Realty Income a Buy, Sell, or Hold in 2025?
summary: Realty Income (NYSE: O) pays its dividend every month.  Paying this consistently growing dividend is important enough that Realty Income calls itself "The Monthly Dividend Company."  Putting aside the company's prioritization of its dividend, Realty Income also has to pay at least 90% of its earnings out as a dividend because it is what's called a real estate investment trust (REIT).

Putting aside the company's prioritization of its dividend, Realty Income also has to pay at least 90% of its earnings out as a dividend because it is what's called a real estate investment trust (REIT).

headline: 4 Dividend Stocks to Double Up on Right Now
summary: Plenty of high-performing growth stocks pay dividends -- such as Apple and Nvidia -- and though their dividend yields can be low sometimes, they can also be fast-growing.  When you factor growing dividends into the total returns of slower-growing blue chip companies, they become much more compelling.
